newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates end up on liquidity crunch.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates end up on liquidity crunch.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates ended up on Tursday owing to a shortage of funds and are expected to stay high on Friday, dealers said.

"The market started with a short note and most of the early deals were struck at 18.95 percent," one dealer said. "Later the rates eased slightly, but they soared back to 19 percent towards the end because of the funds' shortage."
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan announced an auction for the sale of federal investment bonds on July 11.
